ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Xuemei Han
Xuemei Han
Xueimei Han
Xuemai Han
Xuemei Han

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Q.10 - This course provides the opportunity to a would-be Manager to think out of the proverbial box. The course raises embracing management concerns including but not limited to, finance; forestry; economics; and leadership. It provides both a kaleidoscopic view but also a "balcony" view (i.e. a view from a vantage position), of people's interaction with resources and decision making. So consider it!

1. Almost no reading was required for this course. Some reading material might have helped create better structure around the topics covered.7b. TA often wasn't present and didn't contribute during the class.
The Professor taught the course with real life stories as examples. The Professor is full of experience across disciplines.

Learning the difficulties of starting a business and other aspects from the policymakers and competitors. By viewing things in different angles, the existance of many actions or organizations makes more sense to me.

The stories and odd pieces of knowledge that Chad shared throughout. Ex. The answer to how concrete differs from cement. You leave the course feeling like you acquired small, random pieces of information that will prove to be extremely helpful at some point in your career, even if they didn't necessarily relate very closely with the material covered in the course.The intended practicality of the material.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: More examples from economically impoverished and the so-called third world economies would be useful

The hardest part about the course was the shyness of the students. I think the material would have been better covered with a group of students who were discussion oriented. I'm not sure how Chad could have made the students in this class talkative.The classesv2 site should be more frequently used, which would result in less paper being handed out throughout the course.Some of the Powerpoint slides seemed fascinating, but they were hardly ever presented. Would have liked to have heard the content that went along with those presentations.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: High availability and helpful suggestions from the Professor
Didn't request additional help at any point.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: In a sense, i relate to the leadership and decision making aspects of this course very much. I found the simulation exercises very useful and i hope to use them in my future career. My academic background is in some (but limited respect) related to the course. I very much relate to the interdisciplinary considerations in managing resources.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: The name says a lot. I was and i hope to become a resource manager after school.
I want to study environmental related business from different sectors.
To better get to know my advisor.Because I've considered becoming a reserve manager at some point in my career and this course appeared to teach the necessary skills for such a position.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: I struggled with the lack of structure. As someone who learns predominantly through learning there were times I felt lost because material was presented only through lectures.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Maybe. Sort of. Not sure...

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Learning from my peers was the greatest advantage.

We practiced the assignment by negotiating with others as in real life which is very fun and helpful. Although the assignments are sequential and one group worked would have the continuance. A suggestion of changing partners might bea lot of fun and have the experience of dealing with different people.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: They should come to the course expecting to be challenged to think "out-of-the-box". In essence, managing rersources is about time, place, context but also the manager's ability to anticipate change and growth. This course is useful in that sense and many more. Students should take the course as a framework within which they could insert they peculiar circumstances.
Was glad that I took the class as an audit.
